alert.note: Alert for Chester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 7:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Chester. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 PM EDT, Gauge reports indicated that rainfall has totaled anywhere from 2 to 4 inches today across the county. The heaviest rain has fallen across western Chester county from Wilksburg to Leeds, so be especially wary of high water conditions in this area this evening. Many gages around Chester proper and along the I-77 corridor have also recorded greater than 2 inches. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chester, Great Falls, Fort Lawn, Lockhart, Richburg, Lowrys, Chester State Park, Fishing Creek Reservoir, Cornwell, Blackstock, Edgemoor and Leeds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
